Puberty came and went a little too quickly for him, or maybe life passes you by when all you do is play games and geek out, and now he finds himself grown but without any of the social skills a young man like him should have. He's come to you, his only friend, for any help or guidance you can offer.</p>\ <p>One night, he broke down in front of you, spilling his guts about how he's completely shell shocked around girls, and pretty much the same around guys too, other than you. You've noticed his shyness but you thought he would simply snap out of it one day. You had no idea it was ''//this//'' bad for him.</p>\ <p>Of course you would help, without hesitation, but he's offered you something to get you ''//really//'' invested. No student loan debt. That's right. A complete free ride. You know his family has money, but this can't be the right thing to do, or the cheapest for that matter.</p>\ <p>You suggest, "What about, you know, finding a ''//professional//'' that could help you with some ''//companionship//'', if you're that worried about it. And honestly, I don't think you should be. A lot of guys struggle with these kinds of... emotions, at this age." Listening to your friend makes you thankful that ''//crippling//'' social anxiety isn't one of your struggles. Though you do have your struggles. Talking to people has been some what of an art for you. You enjoy learning all the different social circles and their cues. You want to be able to roll with anyone in any situation.</p>\ <<continuelink Next>><p>You really are his good friend though and would hate to see him make such an outrageous offer, when he's down like this, because you know if you accepted it, he would honour it to the letter.</p>\ <p>He replies to your suggestion of escorts with, "I'm not talking about buying a hooker and fucking. Like, that's my base for women? I'm not saying I want this special magical thing with girls... I probably put them on too much of a pedestal anyways, but I'm not interested in just purchasing my way through love. I think that's like, already going to be a problem for me anyways." It's a deeper self-awareness than you thought he'd have. These kind of moments are why you are friends with $friendname though. He's got so much going on, on the inside, and if you hang around long enough, and you're lucky, you get these little glimpses.</p>\ <p>You're still thinking about where he got that observation from, his own family maybe, when he continues explaining himself, "I don't want that for my life. I don't want this either. Fuck, man, what am I doing!?" His worry shakes his whole body as he speaks,"Fuck! $playername... I just want to be better. I want to be ''confident''. I want to be a man, not a sleaze ball."</p>\ <p>You don't know what you're going to do but you agree to help him anyways. He's your friend, he needs you, and it's a life without student debt.</p>\ <p>Really, this isn't about <b>you</b> it's about your friend, and how far you would go to help him out. </p> [[The next day, maybe... |Tutorial_0]] /%--- This runs the "Day Code" and houses the buttons that appear in the debug ---%/ <<include Day_Code>> <<if Config.debug eq true>> ( <<link [[Money |Home]]>><<set $money += 1000>><<set $wear_code_00 = []>><</link>> - <<link [[Confidence |Home]]>><<set $confidence += 1000>><</link>> - <<link [[Bus Pass |Home]]>> <<set $history00.unshift("The_Mall_Pass", "The_Circle_Pass")>> <</link>> - <<linkreplace "Day of the Week">><br><<link [[Monday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 6>><</link>> - <<link [[Tuesday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 0>><</link>> - <<link [[Wednesday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 1>><</link>> - <<link [[Thursday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 2>><</link>> - <<link [[Friday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 3>><</link>> - <<link [[Saturday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 4>><</link>> - <<link [[Sunday |Sleep_0]]>><<set $weekday = 5>><</link>> <</linkreplace>> ) <</if>><br><<silently>> <<include Start_Code>> <<include Day_Code>> <<set $gameSTART = false>> <</silently>> <center> What if ''//your//'' name was... <<textbox "$playername" Mark>> And what if your ''//friend's//'' name was... <<textbox "$friendname" Harrison>> @@.darktext;First Time Playing WFAF@@ <<link "Prologue & Introduction">> <<set $player.id.name = $playername>> <<set $player.id.alias = $playername>> <<goto Prologue>> <</link>> <<link Start>> <<set $player.id.name = $playername>> <<set $player.id.alias = $playername>> <<set $gameSTART = true>> <<goto Home>> <</link>> </center><<set $backpackdisable = 1>> The items in your backpack. Maybe you have but it's probably been years - you two have been friends forever and usually high five or fist bump or... something. Right now though you feel his handshake, the one he must use at his dad's work. It's strong. His hand is... big. It's not super soft like a pencil pushers would be but it's not rough, it wouldn't hurt to feel on your skin.</p>\ \ <p>//What?//</p>\ \ <p>You allow him to shake your hand, giving what you think is the best impression of a girls. You notice how you wouldn't want to give him a firm "manly" handshake and how that causes you to soften your grip, giving him control of the shake. Already you don't feel on "equal" footing him.</p>\ \ <p>//Interesting...//</p>\ \ <p>Learning a lot, you let him lead you into the park.</p>\ \ <<elseif $dnhug eq 1>>\ <p>He steps close to you and like a girl, you raise your arms as if to say "you're hugging me." He falls into the social queue and you lean forward, so he won't feel your boobs too much. You applaud yourself for that little trick, but then wonder if a girl would do that on a date. If she thought he was cute and wanted him to like her would she give him a little chest? She would be trying her best wouldn't she?</p>\ \ <p>//Am I trying to my best to win $friendname?//</p>\ \ <p>You two disengage and exchange hellos . I'm just making friends and having fun. If you don't want to drink you don't have to drink." "Yeah I know, I know... It... just sucks that I like it so much, you know?" Sounds like something your mom used to say. You show your solidarity by poking fun at him, "Water sodas for you now, bitch." [[Wait around... |HP_Bathroom]] <<include HP_Room_SAME_TIME>>\ <<include HP_Room>>\ Jim is halfway naked by the time you and the others realize what he's doing. It's not long before he standing in the middle of the living room in his birthday suit. There's just something magical about a big man running around naked. They look like adult sized babies. The moment is compounded by everyone else being fully dressed, and equally mesmerized as you. Jim marches from person to person cheersing their drinks. Sam, knowing Jim, just turns the music up louder. Word spreads quickly and everyone from the party packs themselves into the living room. To Jim they are his royal subjects. He starts his address. In a speech that's actually somewhat moving, talking about how we all have to live, and not be afraid of who we are, Jim lifts everyone's spirits and takes the party to the next level. But everyone knew he had a Black Lotus so to get rid of the heat he has to move out of state. Cuz they all thought it was him who killed this guy." Got like a ton of money and then has never played again. Quit and cashed out." <<set $hpstory = 3>> <<elseif $hpstory eq 3>>\ "... he just shows them the card." "And they fuck him?" "Yeah, every convention. He finds the hottest girls then says, 'Have you ever seen a Black Lotus before?' He takes them back to his hotel room and whips it out. They want to hold it right? But he's like, 'You got to hold this first.' He'll get like three or four girls at a time and they'l all just suck and fuck him, just to see the card." "No, fucking way." But everyone knows he has it, because he was like a legend growing up, so like, they have these orgies and then poof he's gone." "That's so sick. "Yeah, so now if you even just mention the card to him he'll punch you in your face. He went to prison for this one number he did on a guy. Just like, a normal guy, who didn't know, was like 'Hey, I heard you're the guy who has the Black Lo'-- BAM! -- Punches him in the face and then wouldn't stop. Took like nine guys to pull him off. He says, "Just like pokemon... " [[Remind him what he was talking about|super drunk person][$hp.time += 3]] or leave him and <<include HP_Room_DIFF_TIME>><<include HP_Room>>\ Fuck. Somewhere, in the back of your head, you mark him as a snitch. You give him thanks, for the hose thing, and his wonderful converstation. He smiles, then greenishly looks at his empty cup. He wraps a weird hose thing around his neck, like he's gunna choke himself, but before it gets too morbid he takes a sip at it - trying to take a pull. Sworn to be wed into a distant land's family, the Goddess revealed herself to you. Once you felt her power, the life of being some foreign noble's heir maker was unmade. The Faithful of Nu'Lar took you in. But you would have to forsake your family name and birthrights, forever, in order to accept the high Goddess's truth. You've felt a feast inside you all your life and you ate your way through many things, people, and relationships, until it all made sense. And even then you were scared. You might have known lust, more intimately than your own name, but love? The Goddess showed you what was missing and now you seek to share that which she used to complete you. Love. </center><center>Recently the King has betrothed his daughter to the Great Orc Chief to secure truce between their kingdoms. It was an unpopular move, as the princess was beloved, and the years of war have left a stain of bigotry and hatred towards the barbaric orcs. Nobles have followed their King's example and tried creating their own beneficial relationships with the orcs, but while the highest nobility may find success, some wealthy citizens may not. The merchant's daughter was to become familiar with the new orcs, and that familiarity was to aid in her farther's business, but she hasn't returned and fearing for his beautiful daughters safety the merchant has enlisted the help of those able enough to bring back his daughter. Alive. The orcs aren't good with commands, at least not in large groups, but they do use a couple of horns to organize themselves. If you can blow the war horn, the orcs should mobilize, until they figured out they weren't about to fight, giving Tim the chance to also see how quick they can order themselves. The downside is whoever has that horn likely won't let you blow it for fun... It's well known that orcs travel with a lot of booze, but because of their size they can't travel with enough barrels to keep an orc party satisfied. So they bring orc grog. It's like a super potent alcohol the orcs dilute to their liking. Tim figures you could mess with the proportions of the dilution and poison, without killing, a high ranking official. The right orc, and it would be like throwing a stick of dynamite into the centre of the horde. But it would need to be the right orc otherwise you'd just have a drunkard on your hands... Tim thinks you can also crack open a few barrels of the tightly rationed grog and let nature take its course. It might take some clever engineering but it could be done. Orcs are known to throw huge parties when they're drunk and if they hear booze is flowing, they'll come running. You don't know where you can find these kegs but they'll be easier to track down than the cages... A sound you'll never forget the rest of your lives. Pop. Like bursting a melon he has crushed Bergec's skull between his palms. Bergec's detached body slips from the orcs fingers and slumps lifelessly to the ground. The Orc rears back and shouts - it could be the name of his fallen friend or the battle cry of a dying warrior, but the entire camp, if not world hears his voice. Emerging from their tents, and putting down their mundane duties, the nearby orcs answer their brethren's primal call and surround you. As the sentry falls you can see him snarl a bloody grin. The dirt mantle you stand on, like an sacrificial altar during an earthquake, shakes from the footfalls of ten thousand pounds of screaming orc justice.//@@<hr></center> [[End quest |DND_Bad_End]]<<include Q1_Banner>> You look across the table at the other guys. You can make them do whatever you want. <center> <<if $ruck eq 1>> @@.charnam; $charname@@ //I step forward towards Ruck.// <hr> @@.dm;//Rucks hands reach out and pull you close, as if you weigh nothing. You're not surprised by how strong his grip is, you could hardly struggle out now, if you wanted to, but it's the gentleness of his hands that catches you off guard. He leans his face down towards you. You tilt your head, letting your hair cascade down your back, offering him your soft neck. Her buries his face into your collarbone and, breathing deeply, takes you in. He pulls you tighter, and the unfamiliarity of the embrace causes you to put your hands on his chest and arms. You feel the steel hard muscles underneath his skin. Who knew that orcs felt so... nice. You years in the covenant haven't prepared you for this closeness. You've never been held by an orc like this, or a man for that matter. His invasion into your privacy causes a stiffness through you, but as he muscles his way through your defences you find your have different ideas about the places his senses are taking him to explore. He draws your body even closer and his hands begin to wander, exploring your body.//@@<hr> \ <<elseif $ruck eq 2>> @@.charnam; $charname@@ //I step forward towards Ruck opening the top of my silk robe along the way. Finally enjoying the fruits of my ''//new//'' form, I close my eyes and imagine with him. Letting him pull and inspect. I'm eager to please. It's not easy finding someone who can roll with your games group. Silliness like tonight usually happens. So they're nervous that you'll turn them down, or find another group to play with. <center>\ @@.charnam; $charname@@ "I don't mind helping you boys - I find very little troubles me in the service of the goddess." </center>\ Out of the corner of your eye you can see Sean and David smile. [[Punk this bitch's ass right now |CFO_GAME_1][$cforp = 1; $cfogame = 1; $cfogt = 1; $cfomovie = 1]] <<if $cforp eq 0 or $cfogame eq 0 or $cfogt eq 0 or $cfomovie eq 0>>\ //Or ...// <<else>>\ //Choose ...// <</if>>\ <<include CFO_Options>>"Talking. [[Start right now... since you're here anyways... |CFO_GT_1][$cforp = 1; $cfogame = 1; $cfogt = 1; $cfomovie = 1]] <<if $cforp eq 0 or $cfogame eq 0 or $cfogt eq 0 or $cfomovie eq 0>>\ //Or ...// <<else>>\ //Choose ...// <</if>>\ <<include CFO_Options>>"What kind of movies you watching these days?" He immediately starts answering you, rattling off shows and flicks. You're impressed by how much media this guy can consume. But then you remember that $friendname doesn't actually ever ''//watch//'' anything, he just puts it on in the background. He's one of those people who has to do nine different things at the same time. Seriously, who can watch //Starship Troopers// AND do something else? Psychopaths. You judge him, "Those are trash movies and you know it." You stand firm. Ready for the fight. If there's one thing $friendname has a backbone about, it's your "judiginess". He shoots his eyebrows up, like you're any better, "Sorry if I watch movies where the actors are fully clothed, $playername." Point, he knows you well, but you're not to be out gunned, "//Avatar//?" He's torn. Obviously he wants to contradict you because it was "ground breaking cinema loved by everyone," but he knows your forty five minute speech on those blue pieces of shit almost off by heart. And if he hears it one more time he'll agree with you. He can't let you sway him about the only film he's cried watching. They do wear loincloths though, "Fine, //partially// clothed." Polite concession? Guy is a fucking savage. This ludicrous display forces you to drop your righteous aggression. Must be that distant Canadian blood in you, but you say, "I'm sorry." and... "... it's also a visual masterpiece." He smiles, "Thank you." "Maybe we should watch a movie together though. Something with clothes ''//and//'' substance. With ''//all//'' of our attention. No distractions. Just you and me." He nods. Maybe that's all the help he needs. And maybe JayCam isn't a hack. Who knows... Along the way you remind yourself that you have to be committed and confident. //Take the lead.// You steel yourself as you two enter your bedroom. You break the silence with, "So, I've been thinking, and this role-play thing isn't ''//quite//'' working, you know?" He nods, then puts his hands in his pockets, "Yeah, no, I understand. It was nice of you to try this out. I'll figure out something else out though." "What?" "... what?" "I mean, I think I should have a ''//character name//''. Like so you can call me something instead of doing that 'Hey you,' thing all the time." He fumbles, "Oh, I thought... Sorry, dude." A little annoyed, a little joking, he says "Phrasing man! You coulda just said that." "I thought I was, oh my god. No dude, I'm not ''//bailing//'' on you." "I thought you thought the wig thing was weird and then you were like //this role-play thing isn't working//." "What's wrong with that, I'm just like, you know, being myself. I can't help it if this is how I just act around you." "Well you have to help it." "Help me! We need to figure something out. The more he talks the more open and animated he becomes, it's almost like you are sitting in front of a different $friendname. While you're listening you wonder why you've never seen this side of him before. It's like you've been kept in the dark about all this but putting the wig has allowed you to see $friendname in a new light. You both check the time and agree that it's time to finish things up. He grabs his stuff, thanks you for the drink, and heads home. You clean up the kitchen, washing the dishes... then take the wig off. <<include DSE>> <</if>> Clair is a tall red headed gem. An easy smile with intelligent eyes, she jumps up and greets you; she's really friendly. Lifting her arms she wraps you in a hug; she's also pretty casual. Or touchy. You accept her hug and feel her press against you. Your mouth drying, you have to remind yourself you're here because $friendname is the one who is stiff around women, "Uh, hi Ms. Ross. Thank you so much for seeing me." She heads back behind her desk and indicates for you to take the open chair on the otherside, "Clair, please, and don't think anything of it. John explained everything to me, and it sounds like, you're having some classic //girl problems//. I've been there. Maybe not quite like you, but I was young once too." She brushes some of her hair out of her face and you get a better look at how gorgeous she is. Rolling with her jokes, "Momma never said it would be this tough!" She rewards your quip with a soft laugh, "They never do. Really, it's for us to find out. The journey of womanhood," then adding, "the journey of life." You nod your agreement, smiling not only because she's so fun but also hoping that this goes smoothly. Her demeanour slightly changes and she get's down to business, "So here at the Circle we don't typically work with people as young as yourself, however, I think it's important to work with minds from all ages. I understand your primary concern is... your friend?" [[Next |Clair_2]]Following her prompt, "$friendname, yes." "He's clearly important to you, and since we have data on how vital those early bonds are, especially with regard to how an individual will come to accept their identity, place, survival mechanisms, and similar cognitive understandings and tools, I've made the case to the //powers that be// that we can start working with you. The Circle right now is more of a ''//net//'', not unlike a hospital, that catches people later in life but I'm trying to show we can also be a ''//springboard//'' for individuals." "Great, I'd love to help. Like I said to Mr. McCarther, I actually have no idea what to do or where to start." She reaches across and touches you gently on your arm, "Don't worry hun. We got you," again, switching gears, "Now you're a young individual and I take it you don't carry your medical information on your person?" You shake your head no, "We need all patients to sign medical release forms as well as naming an emergency contact. Would you mother have issue filling this out for you or being your contact?" Not sure if she's probing your relationship with your mom, leaving you wondering exactly //how much// Mr. McCarther explained to her, you answer, "Yeah, I'm sure she could just fill it all out for me. She's pretty busy right now though, like I hardly even see her around the house, um... I don't have a job so she's paying the bills and everything by herself... so, yeah. But when I see her I can get her to start all that, if you'd like." [[Next |Clair_3]]Her kind eyes take you in, and you feel more than realize, how long it's been since an older woman has really taken the time to listen to you say your piece, "$playername, that's ok. We make special allowances all the time. Trust me. We don't want to delay you or hold you up. This treatment is going to take enough time as it is. We can get started now and when she's able to help you out she can. We might not be able to do somethings, but we'll cross that bridge when we get it to it. Ok?" You nod your head, glad she understands, "And there is something here at the Circle you can help //us// with and maybe help your mom a little bit. I'll see what I can hook up but for now we'll just focus on you." "And $friendname," you add. She leans into you, "Of course," she lowers her voice, "But let's start talking the same language before we start talking crazy," her crass humour really calms you down. You're going to like working with her, you can feel it. "Come by next week and we'll have a little chit chat and get this ball rolling." <<if $wig1.owned lt 1>> You begin to grab your stuff but she doesn't let you get away that fast, "In the meantime, have you thought of way to help $friendname take you more seriously? John was saying that you're easing $friendname into this through some introductions in a dragon world?" Wow, that's some broken telephone. Mr. McCarther should know a little better considering what a geek he seems to be, "Um, yeah, we're talking, like roleplaying, kind of like a game, but he says he just sees his friend." "Well, often with roleplaying, people wear costumes. Perhaps a small change in appearance would help get the ball rolling. I'm not saying anything crazy but something to mark a difference between you and who... he'd like to talk to?" "Something costume-y. Ok. Yeah, I can see how that would work. Thanks again Ms. Ross." Clair, last time or you get the smack! My mom is Mrs. Ross and I'm not that old. Right?" "Yeah sorry. Thanks again Clair." "No problem , sweetie." <</if>> Saying goodbye, and awkwardly shaking her hand into a hug, you arrange to meet up next week at the same time. The door shuts to her office behind you, and in the brief moment, when you're all alone, it becomes real for you. You can actually do this. [[Back down the hallway |The Circle Mirror][$circle = 1; $clairvisit.pop()]] "Welcome back $playername! How have you been? I was wondering if I was going to see you or not, I know this can all be a bit much to take on." "Actually, I'm excited. I really want to help $friendname out and honestly, you're probably my best bet." She gestures for you to sit down and you take a seat across from her. Her nod invites you to keep talking, "Um, so yeah, we've just been talking and hanging out. And that seems to be really helping him." "What exactly is it that you two do when you have your hang outs." "Well, sometimes we might watch a movie, or play a video game, something like that, or I might, um, put on a wig and we try talking or something." You watch her face to see how she reacts to this. Knowing you're nervous she says, "That's pretty brave of you. $friendname is ''fortunate'' to have friend who's so giving." It's not really a big deal, "I don't mind. It's just a stupid wig that I picked up at the mall and it helps $friendname get into it." You notice a slight frown when you mention that the wig is stupid. She doesn't move to write anything down but you feel as if she just took a mental note. [[Next |Clair_5]] When she speaks next you get a better clue as to what she's thinking, "I think your commitment is great. In fact, it's probably the best thing - you have to be committed to this. You believing in what you're doing, helping your friend, will only strengthen his trust with you and his willingness to try things he might not be comfortable doing, at first. You have to lead the charge and <b> set an example.</b> You might not think it, but he can read you, so your attitude is important. Kind of like how you're watching me closely right now, because you're nervous, and how I have to set a leadership example." You feel your cheeks burn. You're not sure if you're embarrassed that she's calling you out or if you feel guilty about calling the wig stupid. She continues, "Do you only wear the wig during some activities?" "Yes," you quickly answer. "My recommendation then, since it's helping $friendname, would be to try and keep your therapy as consistent as possible. Wear the wig during all your interactions, if you can. When you're wearing the wig he'll know you're working and in that time you can make your suggestions. Critiquing or helping him otherwise, would feel like it's coming from his friend, that he's seeking help from, and could shut him down. Do you understand?" "Yes." "Now, when you play, does he call you $playername or something else?" [[Next |Clair_6]]Why did she have to say "play"? Your cheeks still red you answer, "We haven't really brought up names." "Well, typically people tend to address each other by name, in most real life situations. The other thing is, there's a theory that nominative determinism also plays a huge role in how other's think of you, as well as forming your own identity. You could help him see himself successfully talking to a girl by introducing a girl's name. If you'd be alright with that." "Ok." You're starting to relax a little around her again. You didn't like it when she thought you weren't serious about this, it's just that you have a foul mouth, and it get's you into all sorts of trouble. "Also, I think you should practice something you and your peers might do on a typical day." You think for a second, "Like going out to eat? I don't really want to, you know, wear the wig around town." "I understand. This is ''private'' . You can find something to do in your own house. But try and think of an activity you could do together. Preferably something where you could continue talk and you two could get comfortable around one another." I'm not ready for somewhere like that. Then I asked you for any kind of help, but I knew that it would be too much to ask you to like, pretend to be a girl and go on a date with me. I don't want you to get the wrong idea and honestly I don't care about my parent's stupid money and, and, uh, and I just don't want to lose you as a friend because you're so nice to me and no one is nice to me, and as long as pretending to be a girl doesn't, like ruin our friendship then I think I can do this." You're surprised he stopped. You thought he was just going to keep talking until he died and didn't have to go on this date, laughing you reply "Relax $friendname, I don't mind! Honest! Like I said, it'll be fun for me to get into the headspace of girl on a date. I think I'll learn a lot about how I can take women out after this. So, you know, no worries or anything." Relieved he says, "Yeah, ok, no worries. Alright. So um, how do you text a girl?" Smiling, you put your arm around his shoulders and start walking with him. As you two walk you begin to explain the very basics of how a text message works... <<set $datenight = 3>> <<include DSE>>In your head you were just being a TV person and Oprah had a talk show. You remembered her name because it was funny to you and you wanted your show to be funny as well. Your dad eventually convinced you to pick another name but the smile never left his face the entire shoot. You had worked it out with $friendname that he would be your big guest. He walked into your living room wearing sunglasses, had his hair all jelled back, and stains on his jeans from where he wiped the grease off his hands. You two talked, but neither could remember your lines you had made up minutes earlier so you just kept trying to give him stuff from your living room, like Oprah did on her show. Your dad gave you the signal to wrap it up when, fearing your ratings were dropping, you got into a fight with one the imaginary audience members. When your mom watched the footage back, she didn't see as much of the humour as your dad and $friendname did. She was upset that you had got hair gel all over her blazer, hers because the shoulder pads were bigger than your dad's, and asked your dad what $friendname's parents were going to think. [[Next |Date_4_2]]Your Dad gave the camera back that afternoon when he drove $friendname home explaining that, while it was an adventure, he could never figure out how to get the record working properly and that he'd replaced the tape used to make the recording. In reality the two of you would fish out the tape, just every now and then, and die laughing watching the three of your make asses of yourselves. Usually those laughing sessions would end with you and your dad doing impressions of your mom but when you got too loud or she came home you'd pack the tape away to its little hiding spot and wait for another rainy day to pull it out.  Sometimes you play the first five minutes of it just to hear his voice. You turn off the shower and climb out. Looking in the mirror you see how much your face has changed. Over the years you've filled out but you don't take too much after your dad. You really do look like someone had just mixed your mom and dad together, giving you strong features from both. Probably for the best, as your dad had these overly stern eyes. Of the few dates you've been on, you've always been complimented on yours and you'd like to think it's the one half way decent present your mom gave you. You make sure your mom's personal things don't look too fucked up. Then, after you close the cabinet, you head back to ''//your room//''. You're not sure what you're going to ''//wear//'' but you're going to have to remember to grab your ''//wig//'', before you head out, and hide it in your ''//backpack//''. <<link "Do Something Else">>\ <<goto Home>> <<set $dninvite = 1>> <<display OBP_Reset>> <</link>>\You greet Clair and sit down. She seems busy with work, but you do have a standing Wednesday afternoon appointment so you imagine she just must be behind in her work. You say, "Hi Ms. Ross." Without looking up she corrects you, "Just call me Clair, $playername. This is an informal relationship," She looks up at you with a wink, "You technically aren't my patient until you've signed all your medical forms." Remembering you agree with her, "Right, right, yeah. Sorry. Clair." She rests her pen on her desk, "Speaking of names, have you chosen one for your sessions with $friendname?" "I have," you pause as you think about telling her. //It's stupid...// "And?" she prompts you. She's your therapist. Or rather she's the therapist that's helping you, you think. This is like telling your doctor something, only there's nothing wrong. You can tell her anything. Finally you say, "I choose to go by $playername2" She leans back in her chair, "That's a beautiful name. How does it make you feel?" //Feel? First was to see how quickly I can write with this new format. There's a lot of challenges with this new style, but the first hurdle is how well does it build. I can say that my new layout works great for adding in more story--I'm thrilled with how fast the passages fell into place and their scaling and code works awesome. Yay. To that end, there's a new quest for y'all to try that was designed to stress test the new Player Object. I'm finally strong enough, or maybe just confident enough, at coding to start work on an Object that can carry vital information about the MC that you, the player, modify with your behaviour. Right now you can only change up your hair length, but your hair does grow! And we'll see more of these kind of mods in the future. I'm always working on design, probably because my skills are always growing, and I've been switching my passages over to work with a tag system. It's interesting--it definitely keeps everything easier for me to access (and building is more streamlined since everything is kept in a single passage) but I don't know if I have all the kinks out of that process yet. Right before launch, which is why there was a delay, I ran into issues with the Tutorial--out of nowhere!--and had to play test out the problem for over an hour. Kinks. And not the fun ones either. Anyway, here's the partial changelog for this update but key notes are this. ▪ The Shaving Experiment. ~23 passages (depending on play style) ▪ Shaving--Am I Pretty-- 4 extended passages (First times) ▪ Little Bubbles... I won't say much, but maybe watch some TV before you go looking for any razors AND ▪ Custom Outfits. GIRLS SAY WHAT?!?! Mall_1>> <</if>> <</if>> <</nobr>>//What does $friendname want at the mall...// The Oakville mall. It's alright, if you like spending a lot of money and pretending to be a bouji fuck who is still shopping inside of a mall. You have feelings about this place. Your first feeling is that it's very far--by bus. With it's massive parking lots, that you have to walk through from the bus stop, the place is designed for those who drive, or own a car. Just getting here eats up a lot of your day and the stores close so early. You practically have to commit your whole day to just coming here if you even want to look around. The three levels are pretty cool though. It's not really that you hate the place, because shopping is fun and the stores are fun, but it's just another reminder that everything in $friendname's life is bigger and better than yours. Your local shopping destination has an infamous strip club attached to it. His neighbourhood mall is probably the best one in the city. Despite your literally poor mood, you smile thinking about how wonderfully strange it is you two are friends in the first place. Sometimes the two of you couldn't be any more opposite and you wouldn't change that unique paradoxical relationship for the world. Well, maybe for a certain post secondary scholarship... It cycles through small start buisnessness that change nothing but the extorir signs, doomed to fail, and shady businesses that are easily spotted at s drug fronts. That all being said, the Strip really get's its name from the gentleman's bar on the end. Like the other stores, that have to share a parking lot with it, this titty bar changes names with every owner, every couple of months. It's swapped hands so many times that people just refer to it, and the mall, as The Strip. <<link Next>> <<set $history00.push("The_Strip")>> <<goto The_Strip>> <</link>> <<elseif $ppt eq 2>> You decide to stash your makeup with your toilettries in the bathroom. And she has a lot. Not that she wears a lot of makeup, all the time. She kept her look really clean, you thought. that's one thing you respected about her. You didn't think "smoothing" yourself would have such an effect but shaving outside your face makes you feel like you're breaking some sort of rule. //Where does your neck end and your torso begin...// You run into the typical problem of not knowing really where to stop. Every time you think you're done, you take a final look and see that you could just even up a little more. Now that your body is so perfectly fucking smooth your pits look extra hairy. You didn't think I would have fun breaking the rules of society? I'm a fucking outlaw!" This is more in reference to you being the poor kid. You've always maintained this narrative that you were some sort of badass because you grew up on the wrong side of the tracks when really, you're just used to going to cheaper places than $friendname.<br><br> "No, I always knew you would have fun doing something like this, I just didn't think you would be so good at it. Maybe other than you can't ever understand women. Not even women understand women. It's not really a thing, like understanding algebra, it's just a made up idea that you can never complete--sort of like how there is no average person; how do you "average" people? $friendname adjusts himself while he patiently waits for you to finish monologuing in your own head.<br><br> You do know that women are creatures meant to be loved more than understood. <br><br> You're about to tell $friendname this when you get that familiar intrusive thought that asks you why you haven't applied this to your mom yet. Knows what he wants and how to get it." He doesn't mention anything about having a penis and you want to believe that's because your friend is progressive, but it's probably just an understood thing.<br><br> You don't really disagree with him, but there's also more to being a man than just being confident. When you think about being a man you immediately think about what your mom gets you to do. The biggest memory that sticks out is killing spiders. Ever since you were a little kid she would come find you and ask you to get rid of a spider. They were scary and you were frightened, but you quickly came to understand that you were meant to do that because you were a boy. Men killed spiders. <br><br> You can still feel where your mom's boss put his hand on your shoulder as he told you that you were going to be man of the house now. He didn't really know you, or your family, you felt, but it was nice enough of him to come to the funeral.<br><br> Maybe you didn't become the man of the house, your mom certainly has found a lot of other guys to fulfil the role and you certainly had to go through unruly teenager before finding any manhood, but you looking at $friendname you realize you didn't have to spend your formative years underneath someone else. His father is man. A man's man.<br><br> You can't imagine what that would be like, even though your dad was strong, confident, and knew how to get what he wanted, he wasn't anything like $friendname's. //Is he even a dad? He's more like a father...//<br><br> Maybe you're reading too much into it. Maybe $friendname just needs to blow some heads off and play some video games. "So, come on over. Anytime. You can shoot some heads off. I won't boss your around or ask you to do chores or get you to write a TR-8R form, or whatever your dad makes you do." <br><br> "It was an ''//FN-2199 form//'', and it was just because it was my ''//first order//''... but thank you." He smiles.<br><br> "But don't think it'll be all sunshine and rainbows, son. Even if yo daddy don't beat you - I'mma whup dat ass. Any game. Any ''//time//''!"<br><br> He grins, "You're dreaming, bud. I'll fucking bury you. Mark my words, pal - I'mma own dat ass. ''//Every//'' game. Every time." Smiling, he checks to see if he has enough time to ''//own//'' you right now. And my words can still look like they're not written by me because they look so happy and fun, and it's weird because... a lot of the humor, in my story, came from him and I don't know how to write the jokes and stuff without him. You know?"<br><br> <<link "Next">> <<goto $location>> <</link>> <<elseif $wh_shave_var_1 eq 19>>/%--- Part 2/3 ---%/ <<set $wh_shave_var_1 += 1>> He nods, but he's also looking at you with that appraising look of his. You don't flinch from it--you're more comfortable in his gaze now--and it makes you briefly think about how often you allow yourself to be vulnerable around $friendname. Yet you're suggesting he does it so much around you.<br><br> That goddam darkness! It's snuck up on you again! You push off from the wall, "I'm having fun. ''//This//'', is fun. You're fun. I love our mission. This is awesome. Life is great. These are good times. Hakuna matata!" He smiles, he get's ya. You shake your head and blow it all out then lean against the door frame again. With $friendname turned to face you it's like you two are lying down just talking, "Anyways... yeah, I think it changes." Making eye contact with your down friend you say, "I don't think you're going to be sad forever, $friendname. I think you're just going through it, but I'm glad you're like, brave and you're trying some new stuff to help you. I think that's like, a pretty good step in a good direction. You gotta take that as a win."<br><br> "Thanks, I do feel like I'm winning. Or like... montaging."<br><br> "Oh you're for sure montaging. This is the training bit of any ''//anime//''."<br><br> "Oh my god, you're ''//still//'', such, a fucking, geek!"<br><br> "Get out! Of my ''//fucking//'' house!" You march towards him as he smiles and tucks into your bathroom for defence. He closes the door and locks it on you before you can grab him. "I let you in! And you do this to me!" He's learned well from you. The piece of shit is strong with this friend. Letting your dark side flow, though you're completely joking, you start kicking the door and shouting your threats of bodily harm. You tell him he's acting like a child hiding in a ''//closet//''.<br><br> "Closet? But I'm not gay," he retorts back like he's some witty genius.<br><br> <<link "Next">> <<goto $location>> <</link>> <<elseif $wh_shave_var_1 eq 20>>/%--- Part 2/3 ---%/ "Oh we'll see about that! I'mma make you my little whimpering bitch. You thought I was helping you become a man!? Fuck. That. Noise. You're my bitch! I fucking swear." He opens the door, and barely fits in it, "Or... and hear me out. Maybe you're just my bitch on PS4."<br><br> He can't defend against that--you're so much better than he is at video games--so he bows his head in defeat. You two laugh, and then $friendname realizes what time it is; you've had him bunkered down in the bathroom for a minute. He says he has to go, but is down to continue montaging with you some other time. You say it's cool and let him skidaddle.<br><br> "One more hit?" He asks, as he grabs his bag and heads out.<br><br> "One more." He touches your fresh shaved skin and lets out whistle. Nodding his thanks he heads out.<br><br> Right befre he leaves he says, "You ok, $playername?" He's so nice; you nod //yes-and-thank-you//. "Ok then. Thanks for showing me I look like man today, $player.id.alias." <br><br> @@.ConfidenceBoost; You feel like his confidence is growing!@@<br><br> You wave //no problem.// as he closes the door behind him. No problem at all... You don't have to look in a mirror to know that you're blushing from what he said.<br><br> <<set $convo00.unshift("Finished")>> <<elseif $wh_shave_var_1 eq 97>>/%--- Part 2/3 ---%/ "You still trying to grow out your facial hair, $friendname?"<br><br> "Yeah, just like you said, it's just, you know, taking some time." He scratches at his $friend.body.face_hair.style beard. It's coming along. <br><br> "That's good, I can't wait to see what it looks like when it's ready."<br><br> He smiles, "Yah, me neither. I wonder if it will be //sexy...//" You roll your eyes.<br><br> "Anything ''//else//'' you want to do today?"<br><br> <<elseif $wh_shave_var_1 eq 98>>/%--- Part 2/3 ---%/ You bring up shaving again until you remember, "Fuck me... never mind."<br><br> "No razors?" He asks, already knowing the answer. "I could always bring you some from my house?"<br><br> "Not it's fine, I can grab my own." You gesture at the nearby intersection visible from your window, "The ''//Gas Station//'' has some but I just never remember to pick them up." You don't mention how much they cost to your ''//finically gifted//'' friend.<br><br> He nods, knowing this is more about your pride than anything else and asks, "Do you want to do something else today then?"<br><br> <<elseif $wh_shave_var_1 eq 99>>/%--- Part 2/3 ---%/ /%---You don't have any razors---%/ "Actually... very little, like not even enough to pick up razors."<br><br> "What?"<br><br> "I'm out of razors." He laughs at you as you stand there with your hands on your hips going //yep-I-just-did-that//. You start pushing him out of the bathroom, fleeing your embarrassment, as $friendname repeatedly asks you what you've been doing with your razors. He doesn't accept your ''//$player.hair.face_hair.style//'' facial hair as evidence of your ''//normal//'' razor use.<br><br> "Shut up!" You're trying to encourage him to grab a controller so you two can play some vidya but he's unrelenting--he's come up with a pretty good story of how you're the neighbourhood dog shaver, stealing peoples' pets and making them hairless so that they might know the embarrassment that you and your fellow mole rat people share. It's elaborate and imaginative, you give him that, but characteristically derivative and a direct result of the trash TV he so regularly consumes. You want to help him come up with a better ''//name-tarnishing//'' story, a la //Citizen Kane//, but you ditch your pretentiousness and let him have fun.<br><br> ''//Pew-pew-pew//''<br><br> He forgets about your hair shaving villainy after you school his ass--maybe you don't have razors but your head shots are pretty fucking sharp--and after licking his wounds he heads out.
